messages.message:
Cypress weekly summary May 12-16
*Summary*: Cypress broken for the entire week soz
• Monday: File upload and extraction errors due to us rotating the OpenAI API key thread (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CSY11CK7T/p1747156438635109)
    ◦ Resolved temporarily on Tuesday 3:31pm by re-using the `ibdev-backend` key
    ◦ Resolved permanently on Tuesday 5:27pm with a dedicated API key. 
    ◦ Thanks @Victor Zeng 
• Wednesday: Extraction failing for community users due to passing a bad org ID and no longer ignoring errors thread (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CSY11CK7T/p1747260027390859)
    ◦ A backend fix (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/70721) was merged Thursday 8pm.
    ◦ An issue with CI deployment prevent this from going out, resolved Sunday afternoon.
        ▪︎ I’m still seeing this issue on `crafting-cyp` for community users, @Serena ~can you continue this investigation?~ nvm, we just needed to redeploy
    ◦ Thanks @Sayan @Serena @Xindi Xu 
• Friday: File upload and extraction errors due to changes in how we do tracing thread (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CSY11CK7T/p1747438513218749)
    ◦ Resolved today at 12:39am by reverting the changes.
    ◦ Thanks @abhijnan

> • A backend fix (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/70721) was merged Thursday 8pm.
Correction: the backend fix was opened at that time, but CI kept failing due to various issues, so I just merged it in this morning.
Ah, that makes sense. Would explain why it’s still an issue atm
Yea... maybe we should redeploy? But somehow everytime i redeploy, things breaks...
Good idea. I’ll fire it off
Let's just redeploy all services. I have no idea which services are affected :sweat_smile:

Hah, yep deployment errors out:
```Unexpected error while starting base config update: Max retries reached: <Response [500]>```
I’ll try again once more. If this doesn’t work, we can wait until 5pm for the automated deployment.
cc <!subteam^S02FJA6A7U5> for the base config update issue
It looks like the current update is going through, let me check the logs for the failed update

`2025/05/19 19:30:24 ERROR controlplane/handler/configs/base_config_handler.go:275 -- GetFileContent failed: GetFileContentByFileName failed: Unsupported file type: text/plain; charset=utf-8. File: /var/tmp/network-policies.zip`

We’ve seen this in the past when the size of the base configs table gets too big, I’ll go in and truncate the DB in a sec
Ok just truncated the DB and everything looks healthy and is loading faster, stats below:
